page.title: 02The Met. Office Bracknell
page.content: The Met Office provideds TV and Radio {weather reports}and a recorded information service for the public. Special forecasts are supplied to air_ lines,ships,oilrigs,The R.A.F.,Navy, Army,farmers,pigeon racers and sports events.Supermarkets can find out how much ice_cream to order,councils when roads will need gritting and bridge builders and crane operators how high winds will be.3 computers make 400 million calculations per second. Forecasts are made every 15 minutes for points all over the world at 15 levels in the atmosphere.There are satellites over the equator and two poles,5 radar scanners in Britain, landstations,coastguards,aircraft, ships,automatic stations and radio_ sondes(balloons 100,000ft)collecting data.There are 1300 emplyees here.
